About Me

Hi, I am Atishay Jain - a Computer Science engineering Junior year student. I have experience working with Python and using and deploying end to end solutions, mostly using web as the platform. Currently I’m working in and increasing my knowledge of the machine learning and data-science domain. I have experience working with Django, Docker, using Jekyll templates and Tensorflow.

Projects

Time-series similarity analysis and it’s applications in data-mining and mutual funds

Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad May 2018 – July 2018

Project Guide: Dr. Vrijendra Singh, HOD IT, IIIT-Allahabad Developed an efficient, non-euclidean distance based algorithm for clustering time-series. Used that algorithm to identify discords in large datasets. This algorithm was also used to analyze trends in stock prices and cluster similar stock options leading to better, more diverse mutual fund portfolios.

Unipool- A cabpool solution

An Android application to solve the problem of cab-pooling at SNU

A team project where we used Firebase and Google Location Framework to create a chat-based cab-pool app to manage Cab pooling to and from SNU. Implemented user login and made use of database management techniques.

Face Recognition by projection into Eigenspaces

An implementation using MATLAB. Understood and implemented an algorithm for face-recognition using eigenfaces and face-spaces as proposed by M. Turk and A. Pentland in the paper ’Eigenfaces for Recognition’.

TimeSpare

https://atishayjain708.github.io/TimeSpare/

A website that provides creative ways to make good use of free time. Worked on front-end using HTML, CSS and Javascript for a website that provides users with tips, tricks and tutorials of varied length.
